data.title: Adding TSLint process to the build
data.body:
This adds TSLint to the build process.  I was sitting on these changes until the Linux PR merged in so I could take those into account.  

There are some significant changes to the node modules on here though, so take note...some of them may need to be thought about and if they are too invasive it may just be that TSLint doesn't need to be part of the editor build.  A less invasive option would be just to store a tslint.json file in the root and have the Atom editor configured to read it during development, but not throw errors on build.

**Changes**
- in node 5, the node modules are flattened out to the top level, so now individual modules no longer contain deep hierarchies of duplicate nodes under nested node_modules directories.  This ultimately saves space, but makes your root node_modules much larger.  Pulling in the tslint and typescript modules added to the root of node_modules.  Ideally, `jake` and `fs-extra` should also be updated to do the same.
- Although you don't want to require npm to build, it might be something to contemplate to reduce the source control size.  There is a way to lock in particular versions of a package via `npm shrinkwrap` and that could be an option to lock down dependencies to the version that you know works ( https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/shrinkwrap )
- TSLint has a dependency on TypeScript and requires that it be located in the node_modules directory so it can be resolved, so now there is a TypeScript folder under node_modules  as well as in the build directory.  Ideally, the one in node_modules would stay and the other one would be removed.  `BuildCommon.js` has been updated to use the tsc in node_modules.
- Added a `tslint ignore` option to the generated .d.ts files since they have spacing and content that TSLint doesn't like.  These _should_ be addressed in the future.  The spacing shouldn't be difficult to fix in the generator, but there are a couple instances where the same variable names are used and that will take some analysis. `HTTP-ERROR` `HTTP-INITIALIZING` `HTTP-OPEN` and `HTTP-CLOSED` are duplicates.

Let me know if this is the direction you would like to proceed, or if you would rather a more minimalistic approach.

-Shad

data.title: Enable/Disable scene view based on tab container visibility
Editor crashed when closing multiple resources using the X button
data.body:
I had several resources open and was using the X button to close each one individually. None of the resources had unsaved changes. I was able to close some files before the crash. 

I have seen this happen on Windows & OSX.

![closingresources](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/722928/11938777/1bf200e0-a7d2-11e5-85d7-a74ff22413e9.png)

data.title: Undo messaging is being sent to all open scene files
CI: Update Windows build box to VS2015 Update 1
Improve UI drag/drop support
data.body:
1) It should be possible to have multiple drag objects at once
2) ListView (hierarchy pane) sets a drag object for the list itself on pointer down event and then clears it on Input subsystem global pointer up, each item should have a drag object precreated and handled properly

data.title: UI updates
data.body:
Fixes issue with multiple up pointer events (with improper coordinates on the up event)
Improves ListView drag drop (hierarchy pane)

data.title: Limit the number of recent projects stored in prefs.json
data.body: There should be maybe tops 15 projects in the recent projects list.  It currently seems unbounded.

data.title: Support editing android sdk/ant paths manually in the Build Settings dialog
data.body:
Currently, the choose button must be used for settings to change, we should hook up the edit complete event to save the build settings if manually entered or pasted, as some paths can't be chosen, such as:  '/usr/local/Cellar/android-sdk'

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Script/AtomicEditor/ui/modal/build/platforms/AndroidSettingsWidget.ts#L65

data.title: Linux build enhancements
data.body: changes to build scripts and source to enable Linux builds. I also added a cmake target to build documentation with cldoc, but it still needs some work. Build_AtomicEditor.sh can now be run from the root and on completion the editor can be run from Artifacts/AtomicEditor.

data.title: Frame limit IPC threads
Add a progress spinner dialog when opening project as generating project cache can take a little bit

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.title: Generated Typescript bindings differ between machines
data.body: When d.ts bindings are generated they seem to differ in order from machine to machine. Might be to do with the order in which input files are enumerated by the filesystem, in which case sorting classes before outputting the ts will solve it.

data.title: Look into sleeping the IPC thread on Editor/Player as may be generating excessive CPU usage
Player quits immediately after sending window position information to editor
data.body:
https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/860ffb836cb7ec8243594ac31fd07d9b3702d17c/Source/AtomicEditor/PlayerMode/AEPlayerMode.cpp#L253

It is pretty amazing that this works at all as the application immediately exits after sending the window changed message, it is probably sensitive to timing and doesn't appear to work on Linux

Instead of immediately sending the  E_PLAYERQUIT event, this should be sending the window position, and then quit request to the editor, there should be a response from the editor which then quits the player application

data.title: Add a check to the example browser to verify that the templates exist
data.body:
If you build from source and do not have a local copy of the examples repo, the following error occurs when loading a template:

![missingtemplates](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/722928/11875803/49bbb172-a49b-11e5-906e-47cfd6789298.PNG)

data.title: Look into frame limiting CPU usage
data.body:
"My performance profile seems to show that mostly the program/editor are sitting in ApplyFrameLimit

Which is a bit odd, given that each process is hitting the CPU 25%.
This is for a completely empty project, not even toontown.

Bit of an odd thing, when I F12 into Time::Sleep and then into ::Sleep for the Win32 #ifdef, it takes me to SDLsystimer.c, the Sleep function. Which is undefined because _WINRT is not defined.
but when matt F12s through, he gets to a sleep function in synchapi.h."

data.title: Cherry pick from 517, fix UI pointer up invocation
Container nodes cannot be moved with editor widgets
data.body: In the scene editor, when a container node (a node with no components used to contain/group other objects) is selected the transform widgets are not displayed. It's often useful to be able to move/rotate/scale objects as a group. They can be manipulated like this by multi-selecting, but container nodes should also be usable for this.

I've done small clean up for the ui pointer event(again), it's related a bit to the #512, because the click/up event was sent twice

I also fixes a scroll(it was fixed before, but it's more clearly way to do that, because UIListView should be capturing widget)
